motions.description: Move the cursor down
move the cursor up
move the cursor left
move the cursor right
move the cursor forward to the start of the next word
move the cursor forward to the start of the next word (words can contain punctuation)
move the cursor forward to the end of the next word
move the cursor forward to the end of the next word (words can contain punctuation)
move the cursor backwards to the start of the previous word
move the cursor backwards to the start of the previous word (words can contain punctuation)
move the cursor to the start of the line
move the cursor to the first non-blank character on the current line
move the cursor to the last character on the current line
move to the start of text on the line
write the contents of the file to disk
write the contents of the file to disk and exit
quit. If there are unsaved changes, then this command will fail.
force quit. Ignore unsaved changes and quit without saving.
move forward to the character typed immediately after starting the motion.
move up to but not to the character typed immediately after starting the motion.
move forward using the most recent motion started using f or t.
move backward using the most recent motion started using f or t.
enter visual mode starting on the character under the cursor.
enter visual line-selecting visual mode starting on the line under the cursor.
move to the other end of the selected text.
exit visual mode.
exit visual mode.
go to the line number typed before gg.
go to the line number typed before G
replace the character under the cursor with the next typed character.
enter replace mode and continue replacing characters under the cursor until Esc is pressed.
replace the entire line under the cursor
repeat the last command.
search forward through the document for the given regular expression.
search backward through the document for the given regular expression.
navigate forward to the next matched pattern specified by /.
toggle case of selection. That is, if the selection is lowercase, it becomes uppercase and vice versa.
make selection lowercase.
make selection uppercase.
move to the other end of a pair of (, [, or { under the cursor.
copy (yank) the current selection to the unnamed register.
copy (yank) the current selection to register a.
paste the contents of register b after the cursor.
